title: Overnight airstrike kills pro - Iran Iraqi fighter in Eastern Syria near Iraq border – Firstpost
message:
The strike occurred in Deir Ezzor province, where Iran wields significant influence and which is regularly targeted by Israel and the United States, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.
Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes primarily targeting pro-Iran groups – which it rarely comments on publically.
In late March, 16 Tehran-affiliated fighters, including an Iranian military advisor, were killed in strikes on eastern Syria.
The strikes also killed one civilian working for the World Health Organisation.
Iran has long been a key ally of the Syrian government, most notably providing military advisors.

title: Pro - Iran Iraqi fighter killed in strike on eastern Syria
message:
An Iraqi fighter from an Iran-backed group was killed in an overnight airstrike in eastern Syria near the Iraq border, the group and a war monitor said Saturday.
The strike occurred in Deir Ezzor province, where Iran wields significant influence and which is regularly targeted by Israel and the United States, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.
Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes, primarily targeting pro-Iran groups — which it rarely comments on publicly.
In late March, 16 Tehran-affiliated fighters, including an Iranian military adviser, were killed in strikes on eastern Syria.
The strikes also killed one civilian working for the World Health Organization.

title: Palestinian Resistance Engages in Series of Operations against IOF
message:
The Palestinian Resistance conducted a wave of operations aimed at opposing the invading Israeli occupation forces, escalating tensions on Friday.
An array of Resistance factions, notably including Hamas’ al-Qassam Brigades and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad’s al-Quds Brigades, collectively engaged in defensive actions against the occupation forces.
The barrage expanded to include large-caliber shells fired as a response to the incursion of Israeli forces into Rafah.
Seizing the moment, al-Quds Brigades dramatically launched a salvo of rockets towards Kibbutz Be’eri, situated east of Gaza City.
Meanwhile, amidst the escalating resistance, the Israeli occupation forces intensified their bombing campaign against the Gaza Strip, prompting a swift response from the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS).
event_breakdown:
al-Qassam Brigades and al-Quds Brigades conduct multiple operations on Friday in response to Israeli incursions into Rafah
Israeli occupation forces intensify bombing campaign and Hamas-led al-Qassam Brigades and Palestinian Islamic Jihad’s al-Quds Brigades fire rockets towards Kibbutz Be’eri
Palestinian Red Crescent Society (PRCS) reports intensifying Israeli bomb attacks

title: Reports say Israeli shelling kills 25 in Gaza refugee tent camps | The Arkansas Democrat - Gazette
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip -- Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians north of Gaza's southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory's Health Ministry and emergency workers.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone.
Hasan al-Najjar said his sons were killed helping people who panicked after the first strike.
"My two sons went after they heard the women and children screaming," he said at the hospital.
At least 10 Palestinians were killed by Israeli fire elsewhere in the Gaza Strip on Friday.

title: At least 25 killed , 50 wounded in Israeli strikes on tent camps near Rafah , Gaza health officials say
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians outside Gaza’s southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory’s health officials and emergency workers.
This was the latest deadly attack in the Gaza Strip, where hundreds of thousands have fled fighting between Israel and Hamas.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense and the Red Cross hospital appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone on the Mediterranean coast, known as Muwasi.

title: Israeli Strikes on Tent Camps Near Rafah Kill At Least 25 and Wound 50 , Gaza Health Officials Say
message:
Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians outside Gaza’s southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory’s health officials and emergency workers.
The locations of the attacks provided by the Civil Defense and the Red Cross hospital appear to be just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone on the Mediterranean coast, known as Muwasi.
The attack near the Red Cross hospital began with a munition that only made a loud bang and bright flash, said Mona Ashour, who lost her husband after he went to investigate what was happening.
“And then they hit with the second one, which was a little closer to the entrance of the Red Cross,” she said.
They struck the place twice.”The hospital’s location is known to all parties in the conflict and marked with the Red Cross emblem, the ICRC noted on Friday.

The video surfaced just before the group claimed responsibility for the naval base attack, asserting that their drones had achieved "pinpoint accuracy."

title: Senior IRGC commander : Israel pleaded Iran not to respond to consulate bombing
message:
“Iranian officials are not seeking a war.
They (Israeli authorities) did not expect Iran to respond,” Hajizadeh stated.
“They (Israeli officials) conveyed their threats through intermediaries.
The senior IRGC commander further noted that Israeli officials reached out to their counterparts in some neighboring countries, begging them to convince Iranian armed forces to lower the intensity of their response.
It came after the Israeli attack on April 1 against the Iranian consulate in Damascus, located next to the embassy building in Damascus’s Mezzeh district.
event_breakdown: Iranian Revolutionary Guards (IRGC) said that Israel expressed its threats against the Islamic Republic through mediators before the missile strikes on the Israeli-held Syrian territory just after midnight Wednesday, in retaliation of the Israeli attacks on Iranian interests in Syria. The Syrian military said that its air defences responded to an Israeli aerial attack just outside of Damascus, downing a number of missiles before they hit their targets.

title: Ukraine complains US is limiting strikes in Russia
message:
Officials have denied the claim, with a Pentagon spokesman insisting that Ukraine “has the ability to hit back”.
Washington had been reluctant to allow US missiles to strike Russia because it was worried about escalating the war.
The row over US rules for Ukrainian missile strikes reignited as Russian forces claimed to have used a FAB-3000 M-54 glide bomb, twice the size of its standard FAB-1500 bomb, for the first time in Ukraine.
A video circulating on Telegram showed massive damage to the village of Lyptsi, in the Kharkiv region, after an alleged FAB-3000 glide bomb strike, even though commentary admitted that it had missed its target.
Some Russian military bloggers, though, have been less impressed with the emergence of the FAB-3000 glide bomb.
event_breakdown: Reports of Ukraine’s strikes on Russian soil, the Pentagon spokesman’s rejection, and concern about intensifying the war. Also the deployment of new Russian weapons in Ukraine, and the spread of video footage showing their destructive effects.

title: Could Israel Iron Dome missile defense system hold up in a war with Hezbollah ?
message:
Could Israel’s Iron Dome missile defense system hold up in a war with Hezbollah?
Now, keeping those weapons from landing in Israel is the job of a sophisticated air defense system called Iron Dome.
This missile defense system has its own cartoon.
Tom Karako is an expert in missile defense at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
Missile defense expert Tom Karako says that if a war begins, it's inevitable that Iron Dome won't be able to protect Israel's big cities the way it has in the past.

title: Hezbollah fires squadron of kamikaze drones with  pinpoint accuracy  at Israeli naval base
message:
Hezbollah fires squadron of kamikaze drones with 'pinpoint accuracy' at Israeli naval baseIran Press TVFriday, 21 June 2024 2:51 PMThe Lebanese resistance movement Hezbollah says it has fired a squadron of attack drones on an Israeli maritime site as its anti-Israel operations escalate.
Hezbollah escalated its anti-Israel operations last week after the regime killed a senior commander of the movement, Taleb Sami Abdallah.
On Tuesday, the Israeli military said that plans for an offensive in Lebanon "were approved and validated."
The same day, Hezbollah published a video showing drone footage it recorded over northern parts of the Israeli-occupied territories, including parts of Haifa's city and port.
On Thursday, Hezbollah said it fired dozens of rockets at an Israeli barracks in the northern part of the Israeli-occupied territories in retaliation for a deadly air strike in south Lebanon.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah has fired a squadron of Kamikaze drones at an Israeli naval base. The attack comes as the Lebanese resistance movement escalates its anti-Israel operations. The attack, which was launched in retaliation for the death of a senior Hezbollah commander, targeted a maritime site near Haifa, a city in northern Israel. The Israeli military confirmed that plans for an offensive in Lebanon "were approved and validated," and the Hezbollah resistance published a video of drone footage over northern parts of the occupied territories. Hezbollah also says they fired rockets at an Israeli barracks in retaliation.

title: Monitor says three pro - Iran fighters killed in eastern Syria strike
message:
Members of Iraq's Hashed al-Shaabi alliance carry the coffin in Baghdad of Abdullah Razzaq Anoun al-Safi, killed in the strike on the border with Syria (Murtadha RIDHA)A war monitor on Saturday said three pro-Iran fighters, including at least two Iraqis, were killed in an overnight air strike in eastern Syria near the Iraq border.
According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the strike occurred in Deir Ezzor province.
The Britain-based monitor, which relies on a network of sources inside Syria, said an explosion was heard coinciding with the strike "in Albukamal countryside... a few kilometres away from Syrian-Iraqi borders".
Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes mainly targeting army positions and Iran-backed fighters including from Lebanon's Hezbollah group.
In late March, the Observatory said 16 Tehran-affiliated fighters, including an Iranian Revolutionary Guard, were killed in strikes on eastern Syria.
event_breakdown: 3 Iraqi pro-Iran fighters killed in Syria by overnight air strike near Iraqi border in Deir Ezzor province

title: Monitor says three pro - Iran fighters killed in eastern Syria strike
message:
June 22, 2024 — Beirut (AFP)A war monitor on Saturday said three pro-Iran fighters, including at least two Iraqis, were killed in an overnight air strike in eastern Syria near the Iraq border.
According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the strike occurred in Deir Ezzor province.
The Britain-based monitor, which relies on a network of sources inside Syria, said an explosion was heard coinciding with the strike "in Albukamal countryside... a few kilometres away from Syrian-Iraqi borders".
Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes mainly targeting army positions and Iran-backed fighters including from Lebanon's Hezbollah group.
In late March, the Observatory said 16 Tehran-affiliated fighters, including an Iranian Revolutionary Guard, were killed in strikes on eastern Syria.

message:

At least 42 people were also killed in separate Israeli attacks on districts of Gaza City in the north of the Palestinian enclave on Saturday, the director of the Hamas-run government media office said.
The Gaza strikes were reportedly also aimed at assassinating a senior Hamas leader.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) released a video of the drone strike that killed Ayman Ghatma, a Hamas terrorist, as he travelled in a car near the town of Khiara, some 25 miles from the Israeli border.

title: Israels raids on refugee camps , houses kill over 100 in 24 hours in Gaza
message:
Israeli troops have carried out yet another massacre in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 101 people in refugee camps and residential areas over the past 24 hours, the Health Ministry says.
One airstrike on houses in the al-Shati refugee camp killed 24 people on Saturday, according to the director of the Gaza media office.
Another 18 Palestinians were also killed in a strike on houses in the al-Tuffah neighborhood, said Ismail al-Thawabta.
The regime’s forces, the Health Ministry said, killed at least 101 Palestinians and wounded 169 in the latest 24-hour reporting period.
This is the highest daily death toll in Gaza since the regime’s forces killed at least 274 Palestinians in an attack on the al-Nuseirat refugee camp on June 8.

title: Detectives nab suspect in fatal stabbing of 40 - year - old man in Manhattan subway station : police
message:
A 24-year-old man has been arrested for the fatal stabbing of a well-liked musician and fashionista at a Manhattan subway station, cops said Saturday.
Diego Figueroa-Hepner faces murder and weapons possession charges in the attack on 40-year-old Johnny Medina near the turnstiles at the 175th St. A train subway station in Washington Heights around 5:55 p.m. Friday, cops said.
When they reached the mezzanine, Figueroa-Hepner flashed a knife and lunged at Medina, viciously stabbing him repeatedly in the chest and neck, cops said.
Medina was a popular musician and fashion enthusiast known as “J McFly” in the community, said his friend, Alberto Frozani.
“He was a designer, a real fashionista.”Frozani said he was shocked as paramedics carried his dying friend out of the subway station and into an ambulance.
event_breakdown: Man arrested in fatal Manhattan subway stabbing of musician and fashionista

title: Iraqi Militia Claims Fighter Killed In Airstrike In Syria
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Baghdad, June 23 (IANS) An Iranian-backed Iraqi Shia has said that one of its fighters was killed in a US two days ago in eastern Syria.
The militia, named Kata'ib Sayyid al-Shuhada affiliated with the Islamic Resistance in Iraq, which is an umbrella body for Iranian-backed Iraqi militias, said in an statement on Saturday that one of its fighters Abdullah Razzaq al-Safi was killed Friday night in a US airstrike on his vehicle while patrolling areas near the Iraqi-Syrian border.
The US Central Command and the international coalition did not comment on the aerial bombardment, which allegedly occurred on Friday night in the Albu Kamal area of Syria's Deir al-Zour province, Xinhua news agency reported.
Meanwhile, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a Britain-based war monitor, confirmed that an unknown airstrike targeted positions held by Iranian-backed militias in the Albu Kamal area, killing an Iraqi fighter of the Islamic Resistance in Iraq and wounding two others.

title: Updated : Russian attacks damage energy infrastructure in multiple oblasts , casualties reported
message:
Russian forces launched missile and drone attacks overnight on June 22, targeting critical energy infrastructure in multiple Ukrainian regions.
Ukraine's Energy Ministry said that energy transmission systems were attacked in southern and western regions of Ukraine, causing damage to equipment.
In Lviv Oblast, a Russian missile struck a energy infrastructure facility causing a fire to break out, Governor Maksym Kozytskyi reported.
In unspecified eastern regions, overhead powerlines were disconnected to "decrease in load on the generating facility," according to Ukraine's Energy Ministry.
As a result of the attacks on energy infrastructure, Ukraine began implementing rolling shutdowns on May 15, but they have dramatically increased in recent days.
event_breakdown:

* Targets include energy transmission systems in southern and western Ukraine.
* In Lviv Oblast, a Russian missile strikes an energy infrastructure facility, causing a fire to break out.
* In unspecified eastern regions, powerlines are disconnected to decrease load on generating facilities.
* Ukraine implements rolling shutdowns on energy infrastructure due to increased attacks.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine Power System For Eighth Time Since March
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Kremlin forces struck a residential area of Kharkiv with glide bombs on Saturday afternoon, hours after a missile and drone barrage directed at Ukraine’s already hobbled power system.
Power grid equipment in the far western Lviv and southeastern Zaporizhzhia regions was hit by Russian air strikes overnight.
Poland’s army scrambled jets, according to a statement on the X social media platform, as it typically does when Russian missiles target far western Ukraine.
Ukraine’s power systems have been a target of frequent air strikes since the fall of 2022 and consumers across the country suffered power cuts lasting hours at a time and often continuing for weeks.
The strikes intensified in March and destroyed around 9Gw of Ukraine’s power output capacity.

message:
US forces destroy six Houthi drones in Red SeaBy VOA News June 21, 2024The U.S. military's Central Command, or CENTCOM, says its forces destroyed six drones operated by Iran-backed Houthi rebels in the Red Sea, the same day it was confirmed the rebels sank their second merchant vessel in the region.
In a release, CENTCOM said its forces destroyed four uncrewed vessels operating Thursday on the ocean's surface and two aerial drones over 24 hours.
The report said there were no injuries or damage reported by the U.S., the coalition or merchant vessels, but it was determined the drones presented an imminent threat.
Meanwhile, maritime authorities confirmed Thursday that a cargo ship struck June 12 by a Houthi missile sank.

Russia launches 'massive' attack on Ukraine's power grid, the 8th in just 3 months, Ukraine's energy ministry saysRussia launches 'massive' attack on Ukraine's power grid, the 8th in just 3 months, Ukraine's energy ministry saysRussia launched a "massive" attack on Ukraine's power grid overnight.
This latest attack marks the eighth since March, Ukraine's energy ministry said.
Russia launched a "massive" attack on Ukraine's power grid overnight as it continues to target the country's energy infrastructure, Ukraine's energy ministry announced on Telegram.
The latest attack marks the eighth time Russian forces have targeted Ukraine's power grid since March, the ministry added.
Business Insider contacted Ukraine's energy ministry for comment.

Russia launched a "massive" attack on Ukraine's power grid overnight, causing power outages in the eastern part of the country. The eighth such attack since March, the attack came just days after Vladimir Putin declared the beginning of his 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

title: More Than 20 , 000 Subscribers Left Without Power In Ukraine Due To Russian Shelling
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) In Ukraine, more than 20,000 consumers were left without electricity as a result of shelling.
In addition, gas companies have restored gas supply to 36 consumers who were disconnected due to hostile shelling.
In one of the settlements, gas supply to 57 private sector consumers was interrupted for technological reasons.
In Sumy region, power companies reconnected 295 subscribers who were cut off due to shelling.
In the Chernihiv region, 1511 subscribers in 25 settlements remain without electricity supply as a result of hostilities.
event_breakdown:
Relevant events found:
Shelling in Sumy region, Ukraine - More than 20,000 consumers left without electricity due to shelling. Power companies reconnected 295 subscribers who were cut-off due to shelling in the Sumy region.
Shelling in Chernihiv region, Ukraine - 1511 subscribers in 25 settlements remain without electricity supply as a result of hostilities.

title: Combined Missile - Drone Hit Sinks Simulated US Ship
message:
SCMP says the simulation involved 12 missiles attacking two Ticonderoga-class cruisers, sinking one.
Its article mentions that an average of six missiles would be required to destroy a large US warship.
SCMP notes that in an alternate scenario, eight of the missiles had cluster drone warheads of six drones each.
As the missiles approached the Ticonderoga cruisers, they released their drone payloads, diverting the ships' firepower and providing more precise target coordinates for follow-up missile attacks.
Meanwhile, it notes, the US is gradually retiring its Ticonderoga-class cruisers with the last one scheduled for decommissioning in 2027.

event_breakdown: The simulation involving 12 missiles attacking two Ticonderoga-class cruisers was reported by the South China Morning Post (SCMP). The cruisers were in the South China Sea.

title: Ukraine Air Defence Triumphs Over Nightly Russian Assault
message:
Ukraine's air defence shot down 12 of 16 missiles and all 13 drones launched by Russia in an overnight attack on Saturday, the Ukrainian air force said.
The Russian air attack, the second large strike this week, targeted critical infrastructure facilities in different regions of the country, the air force said.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Likely Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
A commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden saw explosions near the vessel, authorities said Saturday, likely the latest attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels attempting to target the shipping lane.
Meanwhile, U.S. officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw "explosions in the vicinity of the vessel," the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The report said an aircraft carrier operating in the Pacific would be taking the Eisenhower's place.
The closest American aircraft carrier known to be operating in Asia is the USS Theodore Roosevelt.

title: Likely Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — An attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted a commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden but apparently caused no damage, authorities said Saturday, in the latest strike on the shipping lane by the group.
Meanwhile, the U.S. military ordered the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, to return home after a twice-extended tour.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw “explosions in the vicinity of the vessel,” the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Gen. Yahya Saree, a Houthi military spokesman, identified the vessel targeted as the bulk carrier Transworld Navigator.
The Eisenhower had repeatedly been targeted by false attack claims by the Houthis during its time in the Red Sea.
location: The locations in closest proximity to the events in the passage appear to be the Gulf of Aden and the Red Sea.
event_breakdown:
Location: The Gulf of Aden
Event: An attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted a commercial ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden but apparently caused no damage, authorities said Saturday.
In the Red Sea, the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America's response to the Houthi attacks, was ordered to return home after conducting a twice-extended tour.
In a different part of the Red Sea, the bulk carrier Transworld Navigator was the target of attacks, with the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center reporting explosions in the vicinity of the vessel.
Impact:
* The attack on the bulk carrier saw explosions in the vicinity of the vessel, but the ship was undamaged.
* The USS Dwight D. Eisenhower was the target of false attack claims from the Houthis during its time in the Red Sea, but it will return after a twice-extended tour.
* The attacks on the Eisenhower and the targeted vessel came late Friday.

title: Man critically injured after being stabbed 10 times in Seattle
message:
A man is in critical condition after being stabbed approximately 10 times early Saturday morning.
Officers responded to reports of a stabbing near Alaskan Way and Spring Street at 12:30 a.m. A 28-year-old man with approximately 10 stab wounds, mostly in the back and in the abdomen, was found when officers arrived.
Seattle police said EMT-trained officers provided emergency medical aid including multiple chest seals until the Seattle Fire Department arrived to continue medical aid.
The stabbing victim was taken to Harborview Medical Center in critical condition.
Authorities believe two suspects were involved, but are not sure if both actually assaulted the man.
event_breakdown:
Security Event 1:
A 28-year-old man was stabbed approximately 10 times early Saturday morning near Alaskan Way and Spring Street in Seattle. The man was in critical condition.

title: Multiple Fatalities Reported In Mass Shooting At Arkansas Grocery Store
message:
At least two people were killed and eight others injured in a mass shooting at a grocery store in Fordyce, Arkansas, on Friday (June 21) morning.
A law enforcement officer was among those shot.
The condition of the other injured victims was not released.
Arkansas Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders said she has been briefed on the shooting.
"I am thankful to law enforcement and first responders for their quick and heroic action to save lives.

message:

title: Victim of fatal stabbing identified , no suspect caught
message:
(COLORADO SPRINGS) — The Colorado Springs Police Department (CSPD) has released the identity of the man killed in a stabbing near Remington Park on the city’s east side on Monday, June 17.
Courtesy: Colorado Springs Police DepartmentCSPD originally responded to the area of Remington Park just before 9 p.m. on Monday after a report of a stabbing.
PREVIOUS COVERAGE: Police searching for suspect in fatal stabbingWhile the coroner’s office will determine the official cause and manner of death, Villavicencio-Ramirez’s death is being investigated as a homicide.
CSPD said no suspect has been taken into custody, and detectives continue to investigate the stabbing as well as develop potential suspect information.
This is the 21st homicide in Colorado Springs in 2024.
event_breakdown: Event: Colorado Springs Police Department has identified the victim of a fatal stabbing near Remington Park on the city’s east side on Monday, June 17. The victim was identified as 42-year-old Jose Villavicencio-Ramirez. The stabbing is being investigated as a homicide. No suspect has been taken into custody.

title: Police investigating early morning deadly shooting near Generals Park in Aurora
message:
DENVER (KDVR) – Early Friday morning police responded to a deadly shooting near Generals Park in Aurora.
The Aurora Police Department told FOX31 they responded to a reported shooting around 3:30 a.m. near East Colfax Avenue and Peoria Street, where police found a male suffering from gunshot wounds.
Police said they performed life-saving measures and he was able to make it to the hospital, however, the man later died from his injuries.
The Adam’s County Coroner’s Office is in the process of identifying the victim and notifying their family.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to FOX31 Denver.

Police said they performed life-saving measures and he was able to make it to the hospital, however, the man later died from his injuries.

title: Red Cross says at least 22 killed as strike hits displaced civilians in Gaza as Israel expands operations
message:
Red Cross says at least 22 killed as strike hits displaced civilians in Gaza as Israel expands operationsThe International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) says at least 22 people were killed in a strike that hit civilians sheltering in southern Gaza on Friday.
Following the strike, a nearby Red Cross field hospital received 22 bodies and 45 injured, the ICRC said.
The Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS) blamed Israel for the strike, saying it was dealing with extensive casualties.
The Gaza Ministry of Health said that 25 people were killed and 50 wounded in the attack.
A Palestinian man points to ashes in a tented area, the day after a strike on Mawasi.
event_breakdown: At least 22 civilians were killed in a strike that hit civilians sheltering in southern Gaza on Friday. Following the strike, a nearby Red Cross field hospital received 22 bodies and 45 injured. The Palestine Red Crescent Society blamed the attack on Israel, and said it was dealing with extensive casualties.

title: 2nd LD Writethru : Yemen Houthis say launched ballistic missiles at U . S . aircraft carrier Eisenhower in Red Sea
message:
You are here:视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器SANAA, June 22 (Xinhua) -- Yemen's armed Houthi group said in a statement on Saturday that it had launched ballistic missiles at the U.S. aircraft carrier Eisenhower in northern Red Sea.
However, there is currently no evidence to confirm that the aircraft carrier was indeed attacked.
This is the second claimed attack by Houthis targeting the U.S. aircraft carrier Eisenhower in the Red Sea in less than a month.
The first attack against the nuclear-powered aircraft carrier was on May 31, in which the U.S. military didn't comment.
Earlier in the day, fighter jets of the U.S.-British coalition conducted four airstrikes against Houthi targets northwest of Yemen's Red Sea port city of Hodeidah, according to the Houthi al-Masirah television.
event_breakdown:
Target : Event
Yemen's armed Houthi group launched ballistic missiles at the U.S. aircraft carrier Eisenhower in northern Red Sea on Saturday, according to a statement by Houthi group.

title: US Carrier Strike Group Headed Home After Fighting Houthis in Red Sea
message:
A US Navy carrier strike group that's fought the Houthis for months is finally returning home.
The Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group left the Middle East on Saturday, the Pentagon said.
It will soon be replaced by the USS Theodore Roosevelt Carrier Strike Group.
AdvertisementThe US Navy carrier strike group that's been battling the Houthis in the Red Sea is finally heading home after spending months in the region protecting shipping lanes from relentless attacks by the Iran-backed rebels.
The Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group left the Middle East on Saturday and will remain briefly in the US European Command area of responsibility before returning stateside.
event_breakdown:
US Navy Carrier Strike Group Returns Home After Battling Houthis
The Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group left the Middle East on Saturday after spending months in the region protecting shipping lanes from relentless attacks by the Iran-backed rebels.

title: Russian attacks against Ukraine kill 8 , injure 19 over past day
message:
Russian attacks against Ukraine killed eight people and injured 19 over the past day, regional authorities said on June 22.
The Pokrovsk, Bakhmut and Kramatorsk districts came under Russian attack in Donetsk Oblast, Governor Vadym Filashkin said.
Russian attacks against Kherson Oblast damaged three houses, a high-rise building and an administrative building, said Governor Oleksandr Prokudin.
One man was killed in a Russian attack on the Polohy district in Zaporizhzhia Oblast, Governor Ivan Fedorov said.

title: Argentina Declassifies 2003 Intelligence Report on AMIA Bombing
message:
Argentina’s judiciary has declassified a confidential intelligence report from 2003 that sheds light on Iran regime’s involvement in the 1994 bombing of the Argentine Israeli Mutual Association (AMIA) headquarters in Buenos Aires.
The report, known as the Toma Report, was jointly prepared by Argentina’s former State Intelligence Secretariat (SIDE), the CIA, Israeli Mossad, and the FBI.
Key findings from the report include:Rabbani’s central role in expanding Iranian influence in Argentina, using a “radicalized discourse of the revolution” .
Samuel El Reda’s leadership in the groups responsible for both the AMIA bombing and the 1992 Israeli Embassy attack .
This declassification marks a significant step in the ongoing investigation of the AMIA bombing, which remains the deadliest terrorist attack in Argentina’s history.
event_breakdown:
Argentina court declassifies 2003 intelligence report on Iran involvement in 1994 Buenos Aires bombing
Argentina court declassifies 2003 intelligence report on Iran involvement in 1994 Buenos Aires bombing

title: 25 killed in strikes on camp near Rafah , Gaza ministry says – DW – 06 / 22 / 2024
message:
Officials and witnesses in Gaza said Israeli shelling killed at least 25 people in a camp for displaced Palestinians, with the Red Cross reporting similar deaths and injuries.
The Gaza Health Ministry on Friday said at least 25 people had been killed and another 50 injured in what authorities labeled an Israeli attack on a tent camp in Muwasi, near Rafah city, in the southern Gaza Strip.
Eyewitnesses said Israeli forces shelled the camp, in an area just outside an Israeli-designated safe zone and where thousands have fled since Israel launched its Rafah offensive in May.
Red Cross denounces attack on camps near officeThe International Red Cross (ICRC) in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories condemned the strike, saying it landed near its Gaza office and residences.
The Gaza Health Ministry says Israel has killed more than 37,000 people since it launched its retaliatory offensive.
event_breakdown: Israeli shelling kills 25 people in a camp for displaced Palestinians near Rafah city in the southern Gaza Strip, with at least 50 injured.

title: Russia says it hit Ukraine energy facilities overnight
message:
Russia says it hit Ukraine’s energy facilities overnight1 minuteMOSCOW (Reuters) – Russia launched a large-scale overnight strike on Ukrainian energy infrastructure overnight, the Russian Defence Ministry said on Saturday.
According to the ministry, Russia targeted energy facilities that support military production, as well as ammunition depots.
Long-range missiles launched from aircraft and ships, along with drones, were used in the attack.
event_breakdown: Russia hit Ukraine's energy facilities overnight.

title: Israeli shot dead in Kalkilya , car burned - The Jerusalem Post

title: Russian attack on Kharkiv kills 3 , injures 29 , including children
message:
Russian forces struck the city of Kharkiv on June 22, killing at least three and injuring at least 54 people, local authorities reported.
Moscow has recently intensified attacks against Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city with the use of missiles, glide bombs, and drones, destroying energy infrastructure and killing civilians.
The Russian military carried out four strikes against the city, targeting a residential area, Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov said.
Russian forces used glide bombs in the attack, according to Governor Oleh Syniehubov.
Three glide bombs hit an enterprise in the Kholodnohirskyi district, and another one struck a five-story residential building in the Osnovianskyi district.

title: Longs man arrested after allegedly attacking woman in her car , attempting to shoot her
message:
HORRY COUNTY, SC (WMBF) - A Longs man is facing serious charges after he allegedly attacked a woman and attempted to shoot her last month.
Horry County police arrested 18-year-old Jalene Heggers on Thursday in connection with the scary attack from May 28.
The victim reported the attack while being treated at a Carolina Forest hospital.
The arrest warrant states that Hegger “did shoot at, and strike the victim’s vehicle while the victim was seated in the vehicle.” It also confirmed that Hegger knew the victim through a past relationship.
Hegger is now charged with attempted murder and is being held at the J Reuben Long Detention Center under no bond.

title: Ukraine Border Guards Engage Russian EW System , Artillery In Precision Strikes
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Ukrainian border guards operating in the Bakhmut axis destroyed two Russian artillery systems and an electronic warfare system, posting the relevant footage on social media.
The report comes from the force's press service , as seen by Ukrinform.
"In the direction of Bakhmut, fire support unit of the Pomsta brigade destroyed the invaders' EW station along with 105mm M101 howitzers," the statement reads.
Two enemy 122-mm D-30 howitzers were also destroyed with the use of attack drones operated by the Phoenix unit.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, Ukraine's Defense Forces hit three units of valuable Russian hardware, in particular the R-934B Sinitsa air defense system, the Murom-M monitoring system, and a Tor-M2 tactical anti-aircraft warfare system.
event_breakdown: Ukraine's border guards operating in Bakhmut axis destroyed two Russian artillery systems and an electronic warfare system.

title: EC - 37B Compass Call Electronic Warfare Aircraft , US
message:
The EA-37B (previously EC-37B) Compass Call electronic warfare (EW) aircraft is being developed to provide improved electronic attack capabilities for the US Air Force (USAF) based on the Gulfstream G550 commercial business jet.
It is equipped with the existing Compass Call EW system installed on the ageing Lockheed Martin-built EC-130H Compass Call electronic attack aircraft.
The EA-37B Compass Call aircraft will be delivered to the 55th Electronic Combat Group (ECG) located at Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Tucson, Arizona.
EA-37B Compass Call EW aircraft developmentThe USAF announced its proposal to retire the existing fleet of EC-130H Compass Call aircraft from its service in 2014.
The Baseline 3 package provides more electronic warfare capabilities compared to the package installed in the EC-130H Compass Call aircraft.
event_breakdown: USA, Arizona: The U.S. Air Force (USAF) has announced that it will retire its existing fleet of EC-130H Compass Call aircraft from its service in 2014. The USAF plans to replace the EC-130H with the EA-37B (formerly EC-37B) electronic warfare version of the Gulfstream G550 commercial business jet. The 55th Electronic Combat Group (ECG) operating out of Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Tucson, Arizona, will be the first unit to fly the EA-37B.

title: Indian Army PARA SF Gets Lethal Edge with Laser Target Designators – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Indian Army’s PARA SF Gets Lethal Edge with Laser Target Designators| BySOURCE: AFIThe Indian Army’s elite PARA Special Forces (SF) have received a significant upgrade in their operational capabilities with the induction of Laser Target Designators (LTDs).
These portable devices mark a game-changer for PARA SF, particularly in dense conflict zones, by enabling them to carry out highly precise strikes on enemy positions.
Upon release, these munitions home in on the reflected laser signature, ensuring pinpoint accuracy and minimal collateral damage.
The deployment of LTDs empowers small PARA SF teams on the ground.

title: Iraqi militia claims fighter killed in airstrike in Syria
message:
Baghdad, June 23 : An Iranian-backed Iraqi Shia militia has said that one of its fighters was killed in a US airstrike two days ago in eastern Syria.
The militia, named Kata'ib Sayyid al-Shuhada affiliated with the Islamic Resistance in Iraq, which is an umbrella body for Iranian-backed Iraqi militias, said in an online statement on Saturday that one of its fighters Abdullah Razzaq al-Safi was killed Friday night in a US airstrike on his vehicle while patrolling areas near the Iraqi-Syrian border.
The US Central Command and the international coalition did not comment on the aerial bombardment, which allegedly occurred on Friday night in the Albu Kamal area of Syria's Deir al-Zour province, Xinhua news agency reported.
Meanwhile, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a Britain-based war monitor, confirmed that an unknown airstrike targeted positions held by Iranian-backed militias in the Albu Kamal area, killing an Iraqi fighter of the Islamic Resistance in Iraq and wounding two others.

title: China Planning To Isolate Taiwan Without Firing A Single Shot ? Here What We Know
message:
China could potentially isolate Taiwan through a maritime “quarantine strategy” amid the escalating tensions in the maritime boundary separating the two, according to the Washington-based think tank Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS).
The strategy seeks to exert pressure on Taiwan while avoiding direct military confrontation with the United States, which supports Taiwan’s defence.
This move comes amid heightened tensions in the region, with Taiwan maintaining unofficial relations with major Western democracies.
Critics argue that the strategy could push Taiwan towards declaring independence, a move Beijing has threatened to oppose with force.
Beijing had released a notice about punishing “‘Taiwan independence’ diehards for splitting the country and inciting secession”.

An aerial drone likely launched by Yemen's Houthi rebels struck and damaged a vessel in the Red Sea on Sunday, officials said, the latest attack by the group targeting the vital maritime corridor.
The drone attack happened around dawn off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The private security firm Ambrey identified the ship involved as a Liberia-flagged container ship bound for Qingdao, China.
The Houthis have launched more than 60 attacks targeting specific vessels and fired off other missiles and drones in their campaign that has killed a total of four sailors.
The Houthis have maintained that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or Britain.
event_breakdown: Drone attack on Red Sea vessel off the coast of Hodeida, Yemen.

title: Aerial drone likely launched by Yemen Houthi rebels hits ship in the Red Sea
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — An aerial drone likely launched by Yemen’s Houthi rebels struck and damaged a vessel in the Red Sea on Sunday, officials said, the latest attack by the group targeting the vital maritime corridor.
The attack comes as the U.S. has sent the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower back home after an eight-month deployment that saw it lead the American response to the Houthi assaults.
Those attacks have seen shipping drastically drop through the route crucial to Asian, Middle East and European markets in a campaign the Houthis say will continue as long as the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip rages on.
The drone attack happened around dawn off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
It said the vessel sustained damage but its mariners on board “were reported safe.” It did not elaborate on the extent of the damage, but said an investigation was ongoing.

title: Iraqi militia claims fighter killed in airstrike in Syria
message:
An Iranian-backed Iraqi Shia militia has said that one of its fighters was killed in a US airstrike two days ago in eastern Syria.
The militia, named Kata’ib Sayyid al-Shuhada affiliated with the Islamic Resistance in Iraq, which is an umbrella body for Iranian-backed Iraqi militias, said in an online statement on Saturday that one of its fighters Abdullah Razzaq al-Safi was killed Friday night in a US airstrike on his vehicle while patrolling areas near the Iraqi-Syrian border.
The US Central Command and the international coalition did not comment on the aerial bombardment, which allegedly occurred on Friday night in the Albu Kamal area of Syria’s Deir al-Zour province, Xinhua news agency reported.
AdvertisementMeanwhile, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a Britain-based war monitor, confirmed that an unknown airstrike targeted positions held by Iranian-backed militias in the Albu Kamal area, killing an Iraqi fighter of the Islamic Resistance in Iraq and wounding two others.
event_breakdown: US airstrike on Kata'ib Sayyid al-Shuhada militia vehicle in Syria's Deir al-Zour province, killing a fighter and wounding two others.

title: Thousands of Iran - backed fighters offer to join Hezbollah fight against Israel
message:
The situation to the north worsened this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Over the past decade, Iran-backed fighters from Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Pakistan fought together in Syria’s 13-year conflict, helping tip the balance in favour of Syrian President Bashar Assad.
Officials from Iran-backed groups say they could also join together again against Israel.
Officials from Lebanese and Iraqi groups backed by Iran say Iran-backed fighters from around the region will join in if war erupts on the the Lebanon-Israel border.
Thousands of such fighters are already deployed in Syria and could easily slip through the porous and unmarked border.

title: Russian attack on Ukraine Kharkiv kills two : rescuers
message:
Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills two: rescuersKHARKIVA Russian strike on a residential building in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv killed two people and injured more than 50, rescuers said on Sunday, revising down a previous death toll.
Russia has stepped up attacks in the northeastern Kharkiv region after launching a new offensive there last month, seeking to break a largely static front line as the invasion grinds through its third year.
A five-storey residential building was damaged when guided bombs hit Kharkiv city on Saturday, Ukrainian officials said, with the state emergency service announcing the completion of rescue work by Sunday morning.
"As a result of this aerial bomb strike, 2 people have been killed and 53 others were injured, including 3 children," it wrote on Telegram.
An engineer wounded in a Russian strike on an energy facility in the southern Zaporizhzhia region died in hospital, regional governor Ivan Fedorov said on Sunday.
event_breakdown: Russian strike on a residential building in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv killed two people and injured more than 50, rescuers said on Sunday, revising down a previous death toll.

title: Yemen Houthi rebel attack targets ship in Gulf of Aden as Eisenhower reportedly heads home
message:
Dubai: An attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels targeted a commercial ship travelling through the Gulf of Aden but apparently caused no damage, authorities said Saturday, in the latest strike on the shipping lane by the group.
Meanwhile, US officials reportedly ordered the USS Dwight D Eisenhower, the aircraft carrier leading America’s response to the Houthi attacks, to return home after a twice-extended tour.
The captain of the ship targeted late Friday saw “explosions in the vicinity of the vessel”, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations centre said.
Brig Gen Yahya Saree, a Houthi military spokesman, identified the vessel targeted as the bulk carrier Transworld Navigator.
The Eisenhower had repeatedly been targeted by false attack claims by the Houthis during its time in the Red Sea.
location: Based on the information provided, it seems that the main event takes place in or near the Gulf of Aden.

title: Russia missile attack on Kyiv region injures two , damages houses , Ukraine says
message:
Russia missile attack on Kyiv region injures two, damages houses, Ukraine saysreuters_tickers1 minuteKYIV (Reuters) -Two people were injured and scores of residential and other buildings were damaged in a Russian missile attack on the Kyiv region overnight, the head of the region’s state administration said on Sunday.
Of the three missiles launched by Russia, Ukraine’s air defence systems destroyed two over the Kyiv region, Ukraine’s Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk said on Sunday.
Falling debris injured two people who did not require hospitalisation, Ruslan Kravchenko, head of the Kyiv region’s administration, said on Telegram.
Kyiv, its surrounding region and several others across Ukraine were under air raid alerts for about an hour on Sunday morning, starting at 4:50 a.m. local time (0150 GMT).
Reuters witnesses reported hearing several blasts in and around Kyiv at the time that sounded like air defence systems hitting air weapons.
event_breakdown: Kyiv (Ukraine) - Two people were injured and four residential, industrial and other buildings were damaged in Kyiv region overnight after Russian forces fired missiles at the capital, the head of the region's state administration said on Sunday. Ukraine's air defence systems destroyed two missiles over the Kyiv region, the Air Force said. Russian forces fired missiles into the capital in the early hours Sunday while Kyiv and several other regions of Ukraine were under air raid alerts for about an hour. Air defense systems hit several weapons in the sky.

title: Drone attack causes damage to vessel west of Yemen Hodeidah , says UKMTO - World
message:
CAIRO: A drone attack caused damage to a merchant vessel 65 nautical miles west of Yemen’s Hodeidah, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said on Sunday.
“All crew members are reported safe, and the vessel is proceeding to its next port of call,” UKMTO said in an advisory note, without identifying the vessel.
Yemen’s Houthi group has been launching drone and missile strikes in shipping lanes since November, saying that it acts in solidarity with Palestinians in Israeli aggression in Gaza.
Houthis claim attack on merchant ship in Red Sea off YemenIn dozens of attacks, the Houthis have sunk two vessels, seized another and killed at least three seafarers.

title: Man stabbed in south St . Louis , suspect steals car before arrest
message:
ST. LOUIS – A suspect allegedly stabbed a man in south St. Louis, them stole a car of someone who tried to help the victim before his arrest.
According to court documents obtained by FOX 2, Harris charged at the victim while he was sitting on a curb and “viciously stabbed” the victim several times.
Moments later, another person stopped their car to help the stabbing victim.
Subscribe NowDaily NewsThe St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department reports that the victim, a 44-year-old man, was hospitalized in critical condition.
Harris was jailed at the St. Louis Justice Center without bond.
event_breakdown: ST. LOUIS – A man is accused of brutally stabbing a 44-year-old man in south St. Louis, then stealing the car of someone who stopped to help the stabbing victim before police arrested him. The suspect is facing several charges, including first-degree assault and armed robbery, according to local police reports. The stabbing victim is in the hospital in critical condition, and the carjacking victim was not injured.

title: Daughter , 33 - years - old , in jail after stabbing mother and father south of Sedona
message:
Daughter, 33-years-old, in jail after stabbing mother and father south of SedonaDaughter, 33-years-old, in jail after stabbing mother and father south of SedonaYAVAPAI COUNTY, Ariz. - A woman is in jail after stabbing her father and mother multiple times, leaving both of them hospitalized in the Village of Oak Creek, south of Sedona.
The woman, identified as 33-year-old Lauren Levinson, was taken into custody after police found her standing outside the home where the stabbing occurred.
Police arrived at the home off Coffee Pot Rock Road around 5:30 a.m. just before the two victims were found in the house, according to a release.
Watch FOX 10 Phoenix live:The mother was airlifted to a trauma center with serious stab wounds to her back.
Levinson's father had multiple stab wounds to his arms and was taken by ambulance to a hospital for treatment.

message:
The Hezbollah terrorist organization released a psychological warfare video overnight in which terrorist leader Hassan Nasrallah threatened to bring destruction upon the State of Israel in the event of a war in Lebanon.

"In case an inclusive war is imposed on Lebanon, the resistance will fight without restraints, without rules, without limits," Nasrallah declared.

title: UVision Offers Hero - 120 Loitering Munition for Indian Attack Helicopters – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
UVision Offers Hero-120 Loitering Munition for Indian Attack Helicopters| BySOURCE: AFIUVision Air Ltd., a leading developer of Loitering Munition (LM) systems, has proposed its Hero-120 for integration with the Indian Air Force’s (IAF) Mi-17 and ALH-Rudra attack helicopters.
The Hero-120 is a medium-range LM designed for anti-tank and anti-personnel missions.
UVision’s Indian representative, AVision, is a Joint Venture (JV) focused on manufacturing, maintaining, and upgrading LMs within India.
This venture aims to provide the IAF and paramilitary forces with high-tech, domestically produced precision attack solutions.
However, UVision’s offer highlights the growing importance of Loitering Munition systems in modern warfare and the potential benefits they can bring to the Indian armed forces.
event_breakdown:
Proposed Integration of UVision’s Hero-120 Loitering Munition System into Indian Attack Helicopters

As a leading developer of Loitering Munition (LM) systems, UVision Air Ltd. has proposed its Hero-120 for integration with the Indian Air Force’s (IAF) Mi-17 and ALH-Rudra attack helicopters. The target event is the Proposed Integration of UVision’s Hero-120 into Indian Attack Helicopters with the objective of upgrading the precision attack solutions of IAF and paramilitary forces within the country.

The Hero-120 is a state-of-the-art medium-range LM system designed for anti-tank and anti-personnel missions that can be mounted on the helicopters. The Hero-120 is known for its accuracy and ability to engage targets in all weather conditions.

GWANGJU, Gyeonggi Province -- Six commandos parachuted from a Black Hawk helicopter at around 1,500 meters, gliding toward the designated target on the ground for a demonstration of airborne infiltration techniques Thursday morning.

The 707th special mission group, part of the Special Warfare Command established in 1958, was formed to sharpen anti-terrorism capabilities.

title: Israeli tanks at edge of Rafah Mawasi refuge zone , residents say
message:
CAIRO: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of the Mawasi displaced persons' camp in the northwest of the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday in fierce fighting with Hamas-led fighters , residents said.Images of two Israeli tanks stationed on a hilltop overlooking the coastal area went viral on social media, but Reuters could not independently verify them.
"The fighting with the resistance has been intense.
The occupation forces are overlooking the Mawasi area now, which forced families there to head for Khan Younis," said one resident, who asked not to be named, on a chat app.More than eight months into Israel's war in the Hamas-administered Palestinian enclave, its advance is focused on the two areas its forces have yet to seize: Rafah on Gaza's southern tip and the area surrounding Deir al-Balah in the centre.Residents said Israeli tanks had pushed deeper into western and northern Rafah in recent days, blowing up dozens of houses.The Israeli military said it was continuing "intelligence-based, targeted operations" in the Rafah area and had located weapons stores and tunnel shafts, and killed Palestinian gunmen.The armed wings of Hamas and the Islamic Jihad movement said their fighters had attacked Israeli forces in Rafah with anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs and pre-planted explosive devices.Elsewhere, an Israeli airstrike killed eight Palestinians in Sabra, a suburb of Gaza City in the north, and another strike killed two people in Nuseirat in central Gaza.The military said it had struck dozens of targets throughout the Strip.On Saturday, Palestinian health officials said at least 40 Palestinians had been killed in separate Israeli strikes in some northern Gaza districts, where the Israeli army said it had attacked Hamas's military infrastructure.
Hamas said the targets were the civilian population.In Beit Lahiya in the northern Gaza Strip, health officials at Kamal Adwan Hospital said a baby had died of malnutrition, taking the the number of children dead of malnutrition or dehydration since Oct. 7 to at least 30, a number that health officials say reflects under-recording.Israel's ground and air campaign in Gaza was triggered when Hamas-led militants stormed into southern Israel on Oct. 7, killing around 1,200 people and seizing more than 250 hostages, according to Israeli tallies.The offensive has left Gaza in ruins, killed more than 37,400 people, according to Palestinian health authorities, and left nearly the entire population homeless and destitute.
event_breakdown: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of the Mawasi displaced persons' camp in the northwest of the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday in fierce fighting with Hamas-led fighters, as reported by Reuters, with the location of the advance being put on the a map of Rafah in the southern part of the Gaza Strip.

title: Hezbollah targets Israeli barracks after Islamist commander death
message: BEIRUT: Lebanon 's Hezbollah militant group said Sunday it had targeted two military positions in northern Israel with an armed drone in response to the killing of an Islamist commander .Israel and the powerful Iran-backed group , a Hamas ally, have exchanged near-daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted on October 7.Hezbollah's announcement came hours after it published a video excerpt purporting to show locations in Israel along with their coordinates, amid heightening fears of an all-out conflict between the two foes.On Saturday, the Jamaa Islamiya group announced the death of one of its commanders, Ayman Ghotmeh, saying he was killed "in a treacherous Zionist raid" in Khiara in Lebanon's eastern Bekaa area.Israel later confirmed it had carried out the strike, saying Ghotmeh was responsible for supplying the Fajr Forces, Jamaa Islamiya's armed wing, and Hamas with weapons in the area.Hezbollah on Sunday said its fighters launched a strike "with an attack drone" on a military leadership position in the Beit Hillel barracks "in response to the assassination carried out by the Israeli enemy in the town of Khiara".The Israeli military meanwhile said in a statement that a drone had "crossed from Lebanon and fell in the area of Beit Hillel", adding that "no injuries were reported".Hezbollah later said it had struck with a "squadron of assault drones" the "headquarters of the newly created 91st Division in Ayelet Hashahar" near the northern Israeli city of Safed.Cross-border tensions have surged in recent days, with Israel's military announcing on Tuesday that a plan for an offensive in Lebanon had been "approved and validated".Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah responded with threats that no part of Israel would be spared in the event of an all-out war.The Lebanese armed group on Saturday evening published a video showing Israeli positions and coordinates, along with an excerpt of Nasrallah's speech in which he says "if war is imposed on Lebanon, the resistance will fight without restrictions or rules".Days earlier, it had circulated a nine-minute video showing aerial footage purportedly taken by the movement over northern Israel, including what it said were sensitive military, defence and energy facilities and infrastructure in the city and port of Haifa.The cross-border violence has killed at least 480 people in Lebanon, most of them fighters but also 93 civilians, according to an AFP tally.Israeli authorities say at least 15 soldiers and 11 civilians have been killed in the country's north.
event_breakdown: BEIRUT: Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group said Sunday it had targeted a military position in northern Israel with an armed drone. Israel said it had fired at a drone, but that there was no damage.

title: Ukraine missile attack on Crimea kills 2 , wounds 22 : Moscow - appointed governor
message:
MOSCOW: A Ukrainian missile attack Sunday on Sevastopol on the Russian-annexed Crimea peninsula killed two people including a two-year-old child and wounded 22, the city's Moscow-appointed governor said.Sevastopol, a Black Sea port city and naval base on the Crimean peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014, regularly comes under fire from Ukraine but the toll from Sunday's attack was unusually high.
"According to provisional information, today's attack by Ukraine's armed forces on Sevastopol killed 2 peaceful residents, one of them a 2-year-old child," Sevastopol governor Mikhail Razvozhayev wrote on Telegram.The governor said Ukraine had launched five missiles which Russian air defences intercepted over the sea but fragments fell onto the shore area and pieces of shrapnel wounded people.Razvozhayev said the missile fragments hit shore areas in the north of the city and set fire to a house and woodland.Earlier Sunday, a drone launched by Ukraine on Russia's southern Belgorod region killed a man, the governor said.Three Ukrainian attack drones struck the town of Graivoron a few kilometres from the border with Ukraine, said Belgorod governor Vyacheslav Gladkov, with one hitting a car park near a multi-storey block of flats.
"A peaceful civilian was killed.
The man died from his wounds at the spot," Gladkov wrote on Telegram, while three were wounded.

title: Aerial drone likely launched by Yemen Houthi rebels hits ship in the Red Sea
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates -- An aerial drone likely launched by Yemen's Houthi rebels struck and damaged a vessel in the Red Sea on Sunday, officials said, the latest attack by the group targeting the vital maritime corridor.
The drone attack happened around dawn off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
The private security firm Ambrey identified the ship involved as a Liberia-flagged container ship bound for Qingdao, China.
The Houthis have launched more than 60 attacks targeting specific vessels and fired off other missiles and drones in their campaign that has killed a total of four sailors.
The Houthis have maintained that their attacks target ships linked to Israel, the United States or Britain.

message:
Four people have died in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks, Russian officials said a day after a bomb attack on Ukraine’s second largest city of Kharkiv killed three people and left dozens in hospital.
Three people – including two children – were killed by falling debris when five Ukrainian missiles were shot down on Sunday in Sevastopol, a port city in Russia-annexed Crimea, said Mikhail Razvozhayev, the city’s Moscow-installed governor.
Twenty-two people were injured, he added.

title: Israeli tanks at edge of Rafah Mawasi refuge zone , residents say – The Frontier Post
message:
CAIRO (Reuters): Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of the Mawasi displaced persons’ camp in the northwest of the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday in fierce fighting with Hamas-led fighters, residents said.
Images of two Israeli tanks stationed on a hilltop overlooking the coastal area went viral on social media, but Reuters could not independently verify them.
Residents said Israeli tanks had pushed deeper into western and northern Rafah in recent days, blowing up dozens of houses.
The Israeli military said it was continuing “intelligence-based, targeted operations” in the Rafah area and had located weapons stores and tunnel shafts, and killed Palestinian gunmen.
The offensive has left Gaza in ruins, killed more than 37,400 people, according to Palestinian health authorities, and left nearly the entire population homeless and destitute.

title: Ukrenergo power dispatcher dies in Russian attack
message:
Denys Novikov, 38, a power dispatcher at a Ukrenergo (Ukraine's national energy company) substation in Zaporizhzhia Oblast, died in hospital on 22 June as a result of injuries sustained during a large-scale Russian attack.
Source: Ukraine’s Ministry of Energy on TelegramDetails: It is unclear when the strike occurred.
However, the ministry claims that during a recent night attack, Denys and one of his colleague were unable to reach the shelter in time.
Novikov worked in the industry for 20 years, progressing from fitter to substation power dispatcher.

title: Hezbollah targets Israeli barracks after Islamist commander death – The Frontier Post
message:
BEIRUT (AFP) : Lebanon’s Hezbollah militant group said Sunday it had targeted a military position in northern Israel with an armed drone in response to the killing of an Islamist commander.
Israel and the powerful Iran-backed group, a Hamas ally, have exchanged near-daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted on October 7.
On Saturday, the Jamaa Islamiya group announced the death of one of its commanders, Ayman Ghotmeh, saying he was killed “in a treacherous Zionist raid” in Khiara in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa area.
The cross-border violence has killed at least 480 people in Lebanon, most of them fighters but also 93 civilians, according to an AFP tally.
Israeli authorities say at least 15 soldiers and 11 civilians have been killed in the country’s north.

title: The Coming Israel - Hezbollah War
message:
Credit - Rabih Daher—AFP/Getty ImagesIf the deadly and destructive Israel-Hamas war wasn’t already enough, there is a growing fear of a much broader confrontation between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah.
Earlier this week, hours after the Lebanese militant group released a nine-minute video showing surveillance drones patrolling northern Israel, Israeli officials said the country is ready for an “all-out war” and approved plans for an offensive.
The group insists that the war in Gaza—which has outraged Arab public opinion over the high death toll—must first come to an end.
“War is the continuation of politics by other means,” Prussian military strategist Carl Von Clausewitz famously asserted.
It seems that, for Israel and Lebanon, the time for politics is ending and the time for war is almost upon us.
event_breakdown: The deadly and destructive Israel-Hamas war, the growing fear of a much broader confrontation between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah and the Lebanese militant group’s recent surveillance drones patrolling northern Israel.

title: At least 42 people killed in Israeli attacks in Gaza City
message:
At least 42 people were killed in Israeli attacks on districts of Gaza City in the north of the Palestinian enclave on Saturday.
One Israeli strike on houses in Al-Shati, one of the Gaza Strip's eight historic refugee camps, killed 25 people, Another 17 Palestinians were killed in a strike on houses in the Al-Tuffah neighborhood.
This was the latest deadly attack in the Gaza Strip, where hundreds of thousands have fled fighting between Israel and Hamas.
At least 37,551 people have been killed and 85,911 wounded in Israel’s war on Gaza since October 7.
The revised death toll in Israel from the Hamas-led attacks stands at 1,139, with dozens of people still held captive in Gaza.

title: Daughter , 33 - years - old , in jail after stabbing mother and father south of Sedona
message:
A woman is in jail after stabbing her father and mother multiple times, leaving both of them hospitalized in the Village of Oak Creek, south of Sedona.
The woman, identified as 33-year-old Lauren Levinson, was taken into custody after police found her standing outside the home where the stabbing occurred.
Police arrived at the home off Coffee Pot Rock Road around 5:30 a.m. just before the two victims were found in the house, according to a release.
Watch FOX 10 Phoenix live:The mother was airlifted to a trauma center with serious stab wounds to her back.
Levinson's father had multiple stab wounds to his arms and was taken by ambulance to a hospital for treatment.

title: I witnessed unimaginable horrors in Japan WW2 human experiment unit ... I had to speak out for the sake of my children : Vet , 93 , describes jars full of human bodies at notorious Unit 731 where POWs were dissected ALIVE and infected with plague
message:
Sworn to secrecy by the Japanese Imperial Army, Hideo Shimizu carried the horrors he saw at the notorious Unit 731 facility with him for more than 70 years.
He was unable to contain his emotions when he saw a photo among the relics of a large brick building - the Epidemic Prevention and Water Purification Department of the Kwantung Army, or Unit 731.
He found himself telling his wife everything he knew about the building, and finall admitted that his knowledge was first-hand as he had been a member of the biological warfare unit himself.
Unit 731 was built in 1936 in modern-day Harbin, northeastern China, for the Japanese Imperial Army to conduct research into germ warfare, weapons capabilities and the limits of the human body.
I often wonder why on earth Unit 731 had done so many evil things?'

title: Brutality , humanity in Korean War - The Korea Times
message:
By Mark PetersonOne of the projects I’m working on these days is a documentary film about a Utah National Guard battalion that fought several major battles in the Korean War and yet returned home miraculously with no fatalities.
Lately, we’ve been looking at the “enemy” — the Chinese unit that was so beaten up by the Utah National Guard.
The Utah National Guard soldier said, “They were just like us.”This was a rare touch of humanity amid the chaos and violence of war.
In looking at the unit from which most of the soldiers were captured we found remarkable parallels in the Chinese unit and the Utah unit.
The Chinese unit was sent from Sichuan to Hubei for training in preparation for entering the Korean War.

title: Fighters offer to join Hezbollah in its fight against Israel
message:
The situation to the north worsened this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Over the past decade, Iran-backed fighters from Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Pakistan fought together in Syria's 13-year conflict, helping tip the balance in favor of Syrian President Bashar Assad.
Officials from Iran-backed groups say they could also join together again against Israel.
Officials from Lebanese and Iraqi groups backed by Iran say Iran-backed fighters from around the region will join in if war erupts on the the Lebanon-Israel border.
Hezbollah officials have said they don't want an all-out war with Israel but if it happens they are ready.

title: Two CRPF personnel killed in Chhattisgarh Sukma district
message:
SUKMA: Two personnel of the Central Reserve Police Force's jungle warfare unit CoBRA were killed after Naxalites blew up a truck with an improvised explosive device (IED) in Chhattisgah's Sukma district on Sunday, police said.
An encounter between security forces and Naxalites has been underway since the afternoon in the forests of Amjhar and Muhkot villages in Dhamtari districts, Khallari police station area, according to Dhamtari SP Anjaneya Varshney.
Security personnel have also recovered weapons involved in the attack.
The Naxal blast took place around 3 pm near Timmapuram village between Silger and Tekalgudem camps of security forces, over 400 km from the state capital Raipur, a senior police official said.
The security personnel were on motorcycles while their luggage and rations were being ferried in the ill-fated truck," he said.

title: [ From the Scene ] South Korean commandos train to take out terrorists
message:
The special mission group demonstrates an anti-terrorism exercise involving a building-clearing scenario at the National Counter-terrorism Training Center in Gwangju, Gyeonggi Province, on Thursday.
(Republic of Korea Army)The commandos of the South Korean Army’s 707th special mission group, dedicated to countering terrorist threats, showcased operations responding to simulated scenarios at the National Counterterrorism Training Center in Gwangju, Gyeonggi Province.
GWANGJU, Gyeonggi Province -- Six commandos parachuted from a Black Hawk helicopter at around 1,500 meters, gliding toward the designated target on the ground for a demonstration of airborne infiltration techniques Thursday morning.
It took about two minutes for the commandos to gain control of the plane, suppress the terrorists and rescue the hostages.
The 707th special mission group, part of the Special Warfare Command established in 1958, was formed to sharpen anti-terrorism capabilities.
event_breakdown: Event: Commandos with the South Korean Army's 707th special mission group demonstrated operations responding to simulated scenarios at the National Counterterrorism Training Center in Gwangju, Gyeonggi Province, on Thursday.

title: Chhattisgarh : IED blast by Naxals kills two CRPF personnel in Sukma
message:
The killed security personnel were identified as Vishnu R (35), hailing from Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala while the other jawan was identified as Shailendra (29) who hailed from Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh.
The security personnel were part of the Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) 201 battalion.
The IED was planted by Naxalites on the way from Camp Silger to Tekalgudem to cause harm to the security forces.
Earlier on June 17, four Naxals were killed and two others were arrested by the security forces in Jharkhand's Chaibasa, the police said.
The four Naxals killed included a zonal commander, a sub-zonal commander as well as an area commander.

title: Iran increases rocket supply to Hezbollah via Beirut airport
message:
The pace at which Iran is supplying powerful rockets to Hezbollah through Beirut’s Rafic Al Hariri International Airport has spiked, London’s Sunday Telegraph reported Sunday.
Tehran has smuggled weapons to the Lebanese terrorist group by air in the past, and they were then stored in Lebanon’s only commercial airport.
But the Telegraph report, based on anonymous airport employees who are seething at Hezbollah for mixing warfare with their civilian airport, makes a clear case that recent months have seen a significant increase in using the airport for storing strategic weapons.
The idea of using the civilian airport as one of its major storage depots appears to be a lateral maneuver by Hezbollah after the 2020 disaster in which many of its strategic explosive weapons exploded inside their storage area at the Port of Beirut.
Further, the report quoted airport employees describing strange, extra-large boxes that started arriving at the airport since the Gaza war started.

title: Israeli strike kills eight at Gaza aid centre , witnesses say
message:

The Israeli military said it was continuing “intelligence-based, targeted operations” in the Rafah area and had located weapons stores and tunnel shafts, and killed Palestinian gunmen.

title: Iraq : senior UN official condemns Hilla bombing ,
message:
Iraq: senior UN official condemns Hilla bombing, deplores continuing loss of lifeSpecial Representative Ján Kubiš.
Photo: UNAMA/Fardin Waezi6 March 2016 – The most senior Unite Nations official in Iraq has strongly condemned the terrorist bombing near the city of Hilla in the Governorate of Babylon in the south of the country, which today caused scores of casualties, including women and children.
Mr. Kubiš further stressed that he deeply deplores the continuing loss of life and property in yet another terrorist bombing and calls on Iraqis not to be cowed by the terrorists' murderous campaign.
He called on the Government of Iraq to make sure that the perpetrators of these crimes and those behind them are swiftly brought to justice.
“Sooner or later justice avails those terrorists committing crimes against civilians, crimes against humanity”, Mr. Kubiš declared.

title: The Cygnet sunk by an Italian sub
message:
By ERIC WIBERGThe steamer Cygnet was sunk by the Italian submarine Enrico Tazzoli in sight of San Sal- vador early in World War II, when Bahamians were not expecting attacks.
At 4:48pm, Falangas saw a torpedo emerge from beneath the ship and go towards the lighthouse at Dixon Hill, on San Salvador, six miles away.
The donkey motor was shattered into little bits and “large pieces of debris covered the deck, and the ship started listing immediately at the bow”.
Captain Mamais wrote that “the life boats... pulled for San Salvador.
Emile and Elmore Nairne lived on San Salvador, described as “light-skinned” Bahamians, but had all their limbs.
event_breakdown: The steamer Cygnet was sunk by the Italian submarine Enrico Tazzoli in sight of San Salvador early in World War II, when Bahamians were not expecting attacks. The Italians fired two torpedoes at the steamer which sent out a single retaliation shell in response. The Falangas family, who lived on the island of San Salvador, watched as the steamer began a distress signal and the Germans requested their whereabouts At 4:48pm, Falangas saw a torpedo emerge from beneath the ship and go towards the lighthouse at Dixon Hill, on San Salvador, six miles away. The donkey motor was shattered into little bits and “large pieces of debris covered the deck, and the ship started listing immediately at the bow”. All 13 people got off the ship. Emile and Elmore Nairne lived on San Salvador, but, luckily, had all of their limbs.

title: Thousands of Iran - backed fighters offer to join Hezbollah in its fight against Israel
message:
BEIRUT (AP) — Thousands of fighters from Iran-backed groups in the Middle East are ready to come to Lebanon to join with the militant Hezbollah group in its battle with Israel if the simmering conflict escalates into a full-blown war, officials with Iran-backed factions and analysts say.
The situation to the north worsened this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Over the past decade, Iran-backed fighters from Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Pakistan fought together in Syria’s 13-year conflict, helping tip the balance in favor of Syrian President Bashar Assad.
Officials from Iran-backed groups say they could also join together again against Israel.
Officials from Lebanese and Iraqi groups backed by Iran say Iran-backed fighters from around the region will join in if war erupts on the the Lebanon-Israel border.

title: Two CoBRA personnel killed in Chhattisgarh Sukma district
message:
Sukma, Jun 23 (PTI) Two personnel of the Central Reserve Police Force’s jungle warfare unit CoBRA were killed after Naxalites blew up a truck with an improvised explosive device (IED) in Chhattisgah’s Sukma district on Sunday, police said.
The Naxal blast took place around 3 pm near Timmapuram village between Silger and Tekalgudem camps of security forces, over 400 km from the state capital Raipur, a senior police official said.
The security personnel were in a truck and on motorcycles, he said.
Naxalites triggered an IED blast targeting the truck that claimed the lives of constable Shailendra (29) and the vehicle driver Vishnu R (35), he said.
After being alerted about the blast, more forces were rushed to the spot and the bodies were being evacuated from the forest, he said.
event_breakdown: 1. Security forces personnel killed in an IED blast in the Sukma district of Chhattisgarh.

Officials say the charges stem from two incidents on June 2 and June 7 in the Spadina Avenue and College Street area.
On June 2, police said they received a call for a “prowler” in the area around 12 a.m.
Story continues below advertisementThe suspect was later found in the area by officers and arrested.
A 57-year-old Toronto man is charged with two counts of trespassing at night, and possession of a break-in instrument.
event_breakdown:
Location: Toronto, Canada
Event: Toronto police believe there may be more victims after a man was charged for allegedly peeping through a woman’s bedroom window this month. Officers responded to a prowler call in the Spadina Avenue and College Street area on June 2 at around 12 a.m. The man, identified as 57-year-old Toronto resident, was arrested and charged with two counts of trespassing at night and possession of a break-in instrument.

title: Armed Forces Day in Scarborough will be on June 29
message:
On Saturday, June 29, Scarborough is set to hold its ever popular Armed Forces Day from 11am until 5pm.
On parade at the Armed Forces Day at Scarborough.
This year, one of the VIP guests attending Armed Forces Day will be Second World War veteran Ray Whitwell, aged 105, originally from Malton and now living in Scarborough.
(Image: Animated Objects)North Yorkshire Council’s chief executive, Richard Flinton, said: “It is important that we celebrate Armed Forces Day and give thanks to our service personnel and veterans.
“I am proud that North Yorkshire was one of the first places in the UK to have an Armed Forces Covenant in place and the county is home to many who have served, or are serving, in the Armed Forces.
event_breakdown: The event: Armed Forces Day, being held in Scarborough on June 29, 2019.

title: Israel pounds Gaza , killing dozens , as fighting rages
message:
The Gaza health ministry said at least 25 Palestinians had been killed in Mawasi in western Rafah and 50 wounded.
The Israeli military said that the incident was under review.
“Last night was one of the worst nights in western Rafah: drones, planes, tanks, and naval boats bombarded the area.
In parallel, Israeli forces continued a new push back into some Gaza City suburbs in the north of the enclave, where they fought with Hamas-led militants.
Residents said the Israelis had destroyed many homes in the heart of Gaza City on Thursday.
event_breakdown: From April 28 to May 20, the Israeli security forces advanced on the Gaza Strip to Gaza City after a night of intense shelling of the western outskirts of the city of Mawasi. In terms of casualties and fighting, there might have been many dead and injured people in the strip. This may have been the worst night for this sector. The conflict between the Israel Defense Forces and Palestinian militants was led by Hamas. The operation’s stated aim was to assassinate senior Hamas leader Mohammed Deif. While Israeli ground and air units conducted extensive strikes from Israeli territory against Hamas forces in Gaza, IDF special forces operated in areas in Gaza against anti-tank squads and tunnel forces for the first time.
